intro: Tissa stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's tissa, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Tissa stuebelii is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
